caption: Cheap & delicious 😋
Maybe the best Chinese food I've ever had.  Definitely the best Sichuan food I've ever had. Great service too- fast and friendly. They did not add tip to our bill as others have said.  Will go back!

The only downside I felt was that the service wasn't the greatest. We sat down at our table and no one came by for at least 5 minutes and I had to ask for glasses of water. After our order being taken, no one ever checked in with us. I had to flag someone down to get the check. I would understand if they were super busy, but it wasn't that hectic in my opinion. Spicy Spirit
Cuisine is phenomenal and Kelly is consummate chef, hostess, with the biggest heart and smile! Will be my go to restaurant, eat in, take out, party caterer.

I'm someone who eats a LOT of Chinese food and bar none, this is my favorite spot in IL to go for Chinese. The portions are big, the food is authentic and they have a ridiculous amount of space so there's never a line even if you have a huge party.
Take out review! It's nice to have Chinese comfort food in our neighborhood for an insta-fix. The food is good, great for a weekday meal that doesn't break the bank and hits the spot.
Another good spot in Chinatown! Tried their wonton soup and it is really tasty!

This is about the worst hot pot experience I have ever had. The food is of questionable quality; they come in a little paper tray; the staff kept on switching out the butane cartridge. If the food is actually good, I would probably say something nice about this restaurant; but the food taste awful and makes me not wanna eat anything ever again. Waste of money, waste of time. DO NOT GO HERE, DO NOT GO HERE, DO NOT GO HERE!!!!

Authentic Sichuan dishes, aka Chinese Chinese , with American style Chinese available for those who can't handle spicy oil or exciting flavours. I once lived in China. Here,  my favorite dishes are: sliced pig ear in red chili oil and Sichuan style spicy frog.  Excellent service, friendly staff. Go to spot in Chinatown.
Authentic and tasty. Close to parking lot. Rice costs $1 extra though.

This is the restaurant I go back to the most in Chinatown. The food is authentic, the dishes are things you don't get in other places, and most importantly they're willing to accommodate my Vegetarian palate. They actually make dishes off menu that are vegetarian by asking the Chefs for me. This along with Xi'an Cuisine are the most exciting places in the hood.  Edited to add: there are a suspicious number of bad reviews by people with just one review to their name. I would suggest you disregard those. In fact I would like Google to list reviews in the descending order with number of reviews 😜
Pretty authentic
Fine food. Service so so. Location is great, just steps away from cta red line
I love its hotpot! Super delicious!

(Translated by Google) English will follow! Excellent and fast service. Our waitress took the time to explain the menu and advise us dishes according to our preferences. Ideal for a gang of friends or a family. *** Excellent and fast service. Our waiter took the time to explain our tastes. Perfect restaurant for a group of friends or a family.  (Original) English will follow! Service excellent et rapide. Notre serveuse a pris le temps de nous expliquer le menu et de nous conseiller des plats selon nos préférences. Idéal pour une gang d'amis ou une famille. *** Excellent and fast service. Our waiter took time to explain the menu and to suggest some dishes taking in account our tastes. Perfect restaurant for a group of friends or a family.
Pretty nice restaurant. Food was ok, the service: acceptable.
Best Chinese food every had!!

(Translated by Google) The service attitude was super bad. After sitting for 30 minutes, the pot was not on. Also lost our single. The fat cows are frozen together. Called several times, the waiter did not care. Reminder: A cup of yogurt for $6.  (Original) 服务态度超级差，坐了30分钟锅都没上。还把我们的单给弄丢了。肥牛都是冻在一起的。叫了好几遍服务员没人理。提醒：一杯酸奶$6。
They are so rude here, she tells me idk about my order then yells 10 min at me then I say are u sure and she says idk. Make up ur mind don’t lie

We had hot pot. The ingredients were of very high-quality. The broths were very tasty. Well the meat was very good. You could tell that they cut it before because the slices were a little bit stuck together. It did not change the taste.

(Translated by Google) It was not bad when I opened the business. I also recommended a lot of friends to eat. Recently, food quality and sanitation conditions are getting worse. The quality food and sanitation condition is becoming worse and worse  (Original) 开业时还不错，我还推荐了好多朋友去吃。可近来食物质量和卫生条件越来越差。the quality food and sanitation condition is becoming worse and worse

I've been eating in Chinatown for more than 10 years and somehow had never been to Spicy Spirit until now. Overall I think the quality of food is better than most places in the area. I took off a star because of little things like that rice isn't included with the entrees. Usually when you have a group of 10 people and order a ton of food, most Chinese places will give you a couple bowls of rice. In fact, they're usually surprised if you don't want rice. But here, you have to order it for an additional cost. I realize this is pretty minor and I shouldn't be expecting anything for free, but it's a difference in the experience compared to competing restaurants.
The food is little oily but with a good taste, however the service is slow
OK Foods with bad services
Too much oil and salt, fairly expensive, and the tips are included in the bill. Bad experience.

Apart from COCKROACHES, their attitude was really bad. They said if u feel dissatisfied, u can leave right now. It’s the first time I saw that guests were driven away. It’s not a right way to solve the problem. Feel sick
(Translated by Google) The service is super poor and will not come again. I also told my friends not to come to your place to eat.  (Original) 服务超级差，不会再来了，我也告诉身边的朋友不要来你们的地方吃饭

(Translated by Google) The waiter's attitude is very poor. A male waiter highly recommends the old yoghurt. We don't want him to stand up. The other waitress let her take a rice. She directly flips our white eyes and sees the hot pot. The sauce is also lacking in the carton. Can this less shop be serious?  (Original) 服务员态度极差 一个男服务员极力推荐老酸奶 我们不点他就立马臭脸 另外的女服务员让她拿个米饭她直接翻我们白眼 头一次见吃火锅的菜是用纸盒装的 酱料也缺这少那的 开店能不能认真一点
Best Sichuan food in Chicago
(Translated by Google) I was disappointed to eat the Jiugongge hot pot for the first time.  (Original) 第一次来吃九宫格火锅，很失望。
Fun
Very delicious Sichuan cuisine
The MALE server is really bad, barely provides any service but asks for tips. Ridiculous~~~
(Translated by Google) Chinese food has eaten a Jiugongge hot pot, my boyfriend and I have been diarrhea until midnight, everyone is cautious  (Original) 中餐吃了一个九宫格火锅，我和男朋友一直拉肚子到半夜，大家谨慎
The Beijing style yogurt tatstes really good.

(Translated by Google) Advantages: The taste is more authentic Sichuan cuisine. Jiugongge hot pot with bear oil cubes is my love!  Disadvantages: 1 Service is very average: order 29.99 Zhuge grilled fish, the waiter forced the $40 fish, saying that the meat is tender and the fish bones are few. As a result, the dish came up. It was a very small fish, and it was fried very dry, like dried fish. What about good tender meat? 2: Hidden consumption. Every time you order takeout, every dish will be served with white rice. But for the last two visits, there will be an extra charge for rice! The waiter explained that eating at home is not the same as taking out.  In conclusion, in order to avoid the general service and the side dishes with rice, please try to order takeout if you can order it!  (Original) 优点：味道比较正宗的川菜。 九宫格火锅配小熊油块，是我的爱啊！  缺点：1服务非常一般：点29.99的诸葛烤鱼，服务生强推$40的鱼，说肉质嫩，鱼刺少。 结果菜上来，非常小一只鱼，而且被炸的很干，像鱼干，说好的嫩肉呢？ 2：隐藏消费。 每次点外卖，每道菜都会配白饭。但是最近两次去，白饭都要另收费！服务生解释是堂吃和外卖不一样。  结论，以后为了避免很一般的服务，以及有白饭配菜吃，能点外卖请尽量点外卖！

(Translated by Google) The service was worst EVER!!!The foods was ok, we ordered the hot pot, it was all you can eat type, but we would waiting for almost 2 hours for only 4 dishes!!! Don't waste your time in here The service of this store is the worst and worst of the restaurants I have been to! No one, we ordered the hot pot. We only gave us four dishes in two hours. I thought it was like the weight of the little fat sheep. I said that I didn’t want to waste food. After I finished eating, I only ordered it at the beginning. Four dishes, the result is surprisingly small, and I want to add food after eating, tragedy! Waited for more than an hour, reminded me to give it countless times! ! Later, the waiter "grandfathers" finally wanted to serve us, the gas stove was out of breath, waiting for him to change the air, he turned and then forgot! I am also convinced, watching him have been chatting with the Cantonese-speaking guests next to us. When we don't exist, we can't wait, ask him to gas tanks and change them! Such a store that does not treat the guests as a person, will still be far away. In fact, the taste is also general, go to the supermarket to buy hot pot materials to cook no bad, no need to get angry  (Original) The service was worst EVER!!!The foods was ok, we ordered the hot pot, it was all you can eat type, but we was waiting for almost 2 hours for only 4 dishes!!! Don’t waste your time in here! 这家店的服务是我去过的餐馆中最最最差的！没有之一，我们点的是任食火锅，两个小时才给我们上了四盘菜，本来以为是像小肥羊那样的份量，心说不想浪费食物，吃完了再点，所以一开始只点了四盘菜，结果上来的份量出奇地小，吃完想要加菜，悲剧了！等了快一个多小时，催了无数次都不给上！！后来服务员“大爷们”终于愿意给我们上菜了，燃气灶没气了，等着他给换气，他转身就秒忘！我也是服气了，看着他一直在跟我们旁边那桌讲广东话的客人聊天，当我们根本不存在似的，我们实在等不了，去问他要气罐，自己换了！这么不把客人当人的一家店，以后还是绕远点。其实味道也就一般，跟自己去超市买火锅料来煮没差，没必要去受气
Dishes are good and tasty. Don't recommend their lamb though, no taste.
Do not go there. It's not the neighbor's restaurant. Dumplings are very poor. I think they were frozen ... Avoid!!! Hot pot tasted like soap!

My wife is from Chengdu, and she enjoys coming to Spicy Spirit.  It’s the best place in Chicago to eat authentic Sichuan cuisine!  I agree that this place is much better than Sichuan restaurants found in the suburbs.

The food was not good. I had a glass of pepsi and asked for water. The waitress poured the water on top of the pepsi. The waitress was more interested in talking to her co-workers than serving me and my friend. I will NEVER go there again. VERY DISAPPOINTED.

The waiters is extreme rude and ridiculous... they recommend more expensive food, if you keep your idea, they will tell you that the one you ordered will miss some vegetables or something else which is written on the menu ... extremely ridiculous ... guys you can definitely choose other restaurants in Chinatown, this one is real ridiculous... I will NEVER go to this one again

(Translated by Google) The waiter in this shop has a terrible attitude. . Originally ordered Zhuge grilled fish, the waiter insisted on recommending more expensive grilled fish. . When I said that I still ordered Zhuge grilled fish, I told me that the side dish in this grilled fish is only potato chips and cabbage... But there are seven or eight side dishes on the menu. . . Who is this fool? It's ridiculous. . . If you can fight for negative points, definitely give negative points  (Original) 这家店服务员态度极差。。本来点的诸葛烤鱼，服务员硬要推荐更贵的烤鱼。。我说还是点诸葛烤鱼就告诉我说这烤鱼里面的配菜只有土豆片白菜...可菜单上明明写了七八种配菜。。。这是糊弄谁呢，简直ridiculous。。。如果能拼负分绝对给负分

Don’t go to this restaurant unless you want to eat the dish with a cockroach!!! The restaurant is not clean enough. It’s a little bit crowded but I think it’s OK. But the most unbearable thing is I found a cockroach in one of my dishes. It was horrible and disgusting. I told  the waiter about it. He only removed the cockroach and didn’t make a new one for me at all. (Because I found my unfinished meat in the soup.) It was so disgusting that I didn’t  want to eat any other dishes. Terrible service and dirty environment! I don’t want to post the pic to make you feel uncomfortable.

Great place to get Sichuan food. They have some amazing fish dishes including a couple that's off the menu- there was one fish dish with cilantro that was amazing. Service can be slow and needs promoting at times. Definitely would recommend but would suggest coming when not in ultra hurry.
The waitress is very nice, but food not so good
For sure worth a try
Great tasting food with lots of spices. However the cleanliness and waitress staffs need more improvement
Good food for good price
username: C o w z R u L e

caption: The food tastes ok if you like spicy chinese food. However i doubt the cleanness of the place. The floor and tables seem to be greasy.

Spicy  Spirit is a traditional Chinese Restaurant with lots of spicy dishes to try such as : beef & noodles, tofu, eggplant, chicken wings, buttered peas and green beans, and a fluffy pancake. We ordered family style which came to $129 for 11 people. That's about $10 a person; definitely worth it!
Pros: excellent taste, nice service, good quantity Cons: tables are small and limited space between the tables. No free rices.
Fabulous authentic food.
Good hotspot!

Environment 4 stars Food 4 stars Staff 4 stars Price $$/$$$$  We had hot pot here. The taste was very good. Only thing was that the meat was not too fresh (though not like a year old but as long as I can taste that, I do not like it). Other foods were fine.

Tablecloth was dirty, hot pot was way too spicy (painfully burning spicy), and hotpot ingredients weren't fresh. I got diarrhea soon after this meal, similar to another reviewer's experience before. Decent service though.
(Translated by Google) One of the best  (Original) 味道最好的之一
Ordered hot pot last night, no service, food tasted ok but quality was terrible awful! I went to bathroom 3 times after the dinner! Never come back!

Food here was very good indeed but be careful dining in, they are known to add 17% tip to your total bill. Chicago tip in general in every restaurant is 15%, yes it’s not much but it’s considered cheating and lying if they are aware and charge more for their advantage. If you want fairness you can’t really reason with them since they have very bare minimal English. Because they know tip is added on, they try less hard and never filled our water cups. Lose a star because of that.
Don’t try the self-service hotpot. It’s basically a no-service hot pot
Lunch special is for dine in only. So ridiculous.
Service was confusing, had three/four different people wait on us. However, everyone was very helpful. Food was decent and beer was cold.
Food was awful. Ordered Kung Pao chicken and it tasted like a prank. Service mediocre. I ended up here by mistake.
(Translated by Google) Generally, don’t try too much food.  (Original) 一般 建议菜不要点太多 挺腻的

Food was very pretty and presented a variety of delicious flavors. Service was mediocre. When ordering appetizers, we just wanted one appetizer, but our waitress was very pushy about us ordering more... Three people had to insist upon just one appetizer before our waitress left. For entrees, the waitresses delivered one of our dishes to a different table, and didn't realize their error until nearly the end of the meal. We had to go out of our way to insist that we didn't need the dish anymore since we were nearly done with the meal.
The dim sum is standard quality, it's good, hot and reasonably priced but nothing special. Good location right next to one of the main parking lots, easy in and out of Chinatown.
Dim sum used to be good, but quality is now awful

we come in to this resturant because its new and we expect it will be a good place for dim sum.when we sit down，the plates and cups that they brought to us is kinda dirty，and we ask them to change the dirty one for us，and they just told us that the cups and plates arnt dirty，they just old ，all of them are look like that，unbelivable attitude.But the foods are okay.

Dim sum here is pretty good, but pretty slow for the food to come out, especially on the weekends.  The dim sum comes out nice and hot.  You can't just try a couple since there are so many different ones to try.  There are a few unique ones that you some of the restaurants in Chinatown don't have - Fried turnip pastry and their Bean curd wrapped pork steamed in a broth.  Can't beat $3.00 for all dim sum sizes! Validated parking located conveniently  across the street.

I pretty much ate at every Chinese restaurant in Chinatown, this is as close as u get to Chinese food in China, the cooks here definitely have a higher standards of cooking than typical Chinese restaurants in Chicago. I know cause I have lived a big part of my life living in China.
I am from Sichuan. And I have to say this is one of best Sichuan cuisines in Chicago!
very nice Chinese food
